SEARCH
Package danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing

Class MouseMovementDirector

java.lang.Object
danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing.MovementDirector
danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing.MouseMovementDirector
public class MouseMovementDirector extends MovementDirector
A MovementDirector that responds to mouse input. An instance of this class is already constructed with limited builtin input functions. The buttons for these can be altered, and additional input functions (with their buttons) can be added.
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Field Details

    • INPUT_DRAG

      public static final String INPUT_DRAG
      ID for the drag input function. While the button assigned to this input function is pressed, a DragMovementScheme with this MovementDirector would drag the GameObject
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INPUT_ADVANCE_TO_TARGET

      public static final String INPUT_ADVANCE_TO_TARGET
      ID for the advance to target input function. While the button assigned to this input function is pressed, a TargetMovementScheme with this MovementDirector would move its GameObject towards the mouse position.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • MouseMovementDirector

      public MouseMovementDirector(MessageHandler messages, UserInputListener inputListener, Camera camera)
      Returns a MovementStrategy that maps some mouse buttons to input functions.
      Parameters:
      messages - A MessageHandler to log error messages with
      inputListener - to read input through
      camera - the current camera used, in order to determine world-pos of the mouse position according to the camera. Can be null if no camera is used, if the camera maintains the default view, or if the returned MovementStrategy is meant for a MovementScheme of an object that is in camera-coordinates, i.e. moves with the camera.

  • Method Details

    • setMouseButton

      public void setMouseButton(String function, MouseButton button)
      Assign a key to a given input function.
      Parameters:
      function - A string representing the input function. If this function already had a button mapped to it, it is replaced by the new button.
      button - The mouse button to assign to the given function

    • inputPredicateOfMouseButton

      public BooleanSupplier inputPredicateOfMouseButton(MouseButton button)
      Creates a predicate of a given mouse button which returns true iff the button is pressed
